Apple Scab.description: Fungal disease causing olive-green or black spots on leaves and fruits, leading to cracking and defoliation. Not directly a nutrient deficiency, but weakened plants from low potassium or calcium are more susceptible.
Apple Scab.nutrient_deficiency: Low potassium or calcium can increase susceptibility by weakening plant defenses.
Apple Scab.solutions: Apply fungicides (e.g., captan) in early spring. Rake and destroy fallen leaves. Prune for air circulation. Supplement with potassium-rich fertilizer if soil test shows deficiency. Organic option: Neem oil sprays.

Black Rot.description: Fungal infection causing black rotting spots on fruits, leaves, and stems. Can be exacerbated by nutrient imbalances like low calcium, leading to poor plant vigor.
Black Rot.nutrient_deficiency: Low calcium reduces cell wall strength, making plants more vulnerable.
Black Rot.solutions: Prune infected parts and apply fungicides. Ensure good drainage. Rotate crops. Use calcium foliar sprays if deficiency suspected. Organic option: Compost tea for overall health.

Cedar Apple Rust.description: Fungal disease with yellow-orange spots on leaves and galls on branches. Nutrient deficiencies like iron or manganese can weaken resistance.
Cedar Apple Rust.nutrient_deficiency: Iron or manganese deficiency leads to chlorosis, reducing overall plant health.
Cedar Apple Rust.solutions: Remove nearby cedar trees (alternate host). Apply fungicides in spring. Use resistant varieties. Correct soil pH for better nutrient uptake. Organic option: Garlic-based sprays.

Healthy.description: No visible disease; plant appears normal. Monitor for potential nutrient deficiencies if growth is stunted.
Healthy.nutrient_deficiency: General: Check for NPK imbalances if symptoms appear later.
Healthy.solutions: Maintain balanced fertilization. Regular soil tests for NPK levels. Preventative care like proper watering and spacing. Organic option: Mulch with compost.

Powdery Mildew.description: White powdery fungal growth on leaves, stems, and fruits. Often worsened by sulfur or potassium deficiencies.
Powdery Mildew.nutrient_deficiency: Low potassium reduces disease resistance; sulfur deficiency in soil can mimic or exacerbate.
Powdery Mildew.solutions: Apply sulfur-based fungicides. Improve air flow. Water at base. Use potassium bicarbonate sprays. Organic option: Baking soda solution (1 tbsp per gallon water).

Cercospora Leaf Spot Gray Leaf Spot.description: Fungal spots with gray centers on leaves, causing defoliation. Often worsened by potassium deficiency, leading to weak cell walls.
Cercospora Leaf Spot Gray Leaf Spot.solutions: Apply fungicides. Improve air circulation. Avoid overhead watering. Add potassium sulfate if soil deficient. Organic option: Copper soap sprays.

Common Rust.description: Fungal orange pustules on leaves and stems. High humidity and low potassium can increase susceptibility.
Common Rust.solutions: Use resistant varieties. Apply fungicides early. Remove infected leaves. Boost potassium with fertilizer. Organic option: Neem oil for prevention.

Northern Leaf Blight.description: Fungal long gray-green lesions on leaves. Nutrient deficiencies like nitrogen can reduce plant resistance.
Northern Leaf Blight.nutrient_deficiency: Nitrogen deficiency causes poor growth and higher vulnerability.
Northern Leaf Blight.solutions: Crop rotation. Fungicide application. Destroy residue. Apply nitrogen-rich fertilizer if deficient. Organic option: Legume cover crops for nitrogen fixation.

Leaf Blight (Isariopsis Leaf Spot).description: Fungal purple spots on leaves, causing defoliation. Low potassium weakens plants.
Leaf Blight (Isariopsis Leaf Spot).solutions: Fungicide sprays. Remove infected leaves. Proper spacing. Potassium fertilization. Organic option: Horsetail tea sprays.

Huanglongbing (Citrus Greening).description: Bacterial disease with yellow mottled leaves and misshapen fruits. Zinc, iron, or manganese deficiencies mimic symptoms.
Huanglongbing (Citrus Greening).nutrient_deficiency: Micronutrient deficiencies (zinc, iron, manganese) cause similar yellowing.
Huanglongbing (Citrus Greening).solutions: Remove infected trees. Control psyllids with insecticides. Use chelated micronutrients for deficiencies. Organic option: Beneficial insects for psyllid control.

Bacterial Spot.description: Bacterial dark water-soaked spots on leaves/fruits. Copper deficiency can increase vulnerability.
Bacterial Spot.nutrient_deficiency: Low copper reduces natural antibacterial defenses.
Bacterial Spot.solutions: Copper bactericides. Avoid wet foliage. Rotate crops. Supplement copper if soil test indicates low levels. Organic option: Serenade biofungicide.

Early Blight.description: Fungal brown spots with rings on leaves. Calcium deficiency (e.g., blossom end rot) often co-occurs.
Early Blight.solutions: Fungicides like copper. Crop rotation. Mulch soil. Calcium sprays for deficiency. Organic option: Crushed eggshells for calcium.

Late Blight.description: Fungal water-soaked lesions with white mold. Poor nutrition like low nitrogen reduces resistance.
Late Blight.nutrient_deficiency: Nitrogen deficiency stunts growth and immunity.
Late Blight.solutions: Resistant varieties. Preventive fungicides. Destroy infected plants. Balanced NPK fertilizer. Organic option: Copper sulfate sprays.

Leaf Mold.description: Fungal yellow spots on upper leaves, mold below. High humidity; low calcium affects.
Leaf Mold.solutions: Improve ventilation. Fungicides. Prune leaves. Calcium amendments. Organic option: Milk spray for suppression.

Septoria Leaf Spot.description: Small dark spots with yellow halos on leaves. Potassium deficiency weakens defenses.
Septoria Leaf Spot.solutions: Fungicides. Crop rotation. Remove lower infected leaves. Potassium fertilizer. Organic option: Seaweed extract for potassium.

Spider Mites Two-Spotted Spider Mite.description: Pest causing stippled yellow leaves and webbing. Low humidity; phosphorus deficiency stresses plants.
Spider Mites Two-Spotted Spider Mite.solutions: Miticide sprays. Predatory mites. Increase humidity. Phosphorus supplements. Organic option: Insecticidal soap.

Target Spot.description: Concentric ring spots on leaves. Similar to early blight; calcium deficiency co-factor.
Target Spot.solutions: Fungicides. Air circulation. Avoid wetting leaves. Calcium foliar sprays. Organic option: Bone meal for calcium.

Tomato Mosaic Virus.description: Viral mottled leaves and stunted growth. No direct cure; nutrient balance helps resilience.
Tomato Mosaic Virus.solutions: Disinfect tools. Virus-free seeds. Remove infected plants. Balanced fertilizer. Organic option: Companion planting with marigolds.

Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus.description: Viral curling yellow leaves. Whitefly-transmitted; zinc deficiency mimics.
Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus.solutions: Control whiteflies. Resistant varieties. Remove plants. Zinc sulfate if deficient. Organic option: Sticky traps for whiteflies.

Leaf Scorch.description: Brown, dry edges on leaves from stress or nutrient issues.
Leaf Scorch.solutions: Deep watering. Mulch. Test soil; add potassium sulfate or Epsom salt. Organic option: Banana peel mulch for potassium.

Esca (Black Measles).description: Fungal disease with dark streaks in wood and leaf tiger-striping. Poor soil nutrition, especially low magnesium, can contribute.
Esca (Black Measles).solutions: Prune infected wood. Use biofungicides. Improve soil with magnesium amendments like Epsom salt. Organic option: Trichoderma-based products.

Nitrogen Deficiency.description: Yellowing of older leaves, stunted growth.
Nitrogen Deficiency.solutions: Apply nitrogen-rich fertilizer like urea. Use compost or manure. Test soil pH. Organic option: Blood meal or fish emulsion.

Phosphorus Deficiency.description: Purple or dark green leaves, delayed maturity.
Phosphorus Deficiency.solutions: Add phosphorus fertilizer like superphosphate. Ensure soil pH 6-7. Use bone meal. Organic option: Rock phosphate.

Potassium Deficiency.description: Brown scorching on leaf edges, weak stems.
Potassium Deficiency.solutions: Apply potash fertilizer like potassium sulfate. Mulch with potassium-rich materials. Organic option: Wood ash or kelp meal.

Calcium Deficiency.description: Blossom end rot, distorted new growth.
Calcium Deficiency.solutions: Add lime or gypsum to soil. Maintain consistent watering. Foliar calcium sprays. Organic option: Eggshell powder.

Magnesium Deficiency.solutions: Apply Epsom salt (magnesium sulfate). Dolomitic lime for soil amendment. Organic option: Composted leaves.

Iron Deficiency.description: Yellowing between veins on young leaves.
Iron Deficiency.solutions: Use chelated iron fertilizers. Lower soil pH with sulfur if alkaline. Organic option: Iron-rich compost.

Manganese Deficiency.solutions: Foliar spray manganese sulfate. Lower soil pH if alkaline. Organic option: Pine needle mulch to acidify soil.

Zinc Deficiency.solutions: Apply zinc sulfate. Chelated zinc for foliar spray. Organic option: Zinc-enriched compost.

Heart Rot.description: Rotting at the center of the plant.
Heart Rot.solutions: Improve drainage. Apply boron if deficient. Fungicides for fungal causes. Organic option: Borax in small doses.

Unknown Issue.description: Unable to identify; may be environmental stress or mixed symptoms.
Unknown Issue.solutions: Soil test for nutrients. Consult expert. Monitor watering/light. Organic option: General compost application.
